Package shaharas

Class Add

java.lang.Object
shaharas.BaseOperators
shaharas.BaseBinaryOperators
shaharas.Add
All Implemented Interfaces:
Operators
public class Add extends BaseBinaryOperators
The Add class represents the addition operator (`+`). It extends the BaseBinaryOperators class and provides the functionality to add two operands.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Add()
    Default constructor that initializes the left operand to 0, sets the operator pattern to match `+`, sets the operator symbol to "+" and assigns the regular operator priority.
    Add(int a)
    Constructor that initializes the left operand to the given value (`a`), sets the operator pattern to match `+`, sets the operator symbol to "+" and assigns the regular operator priority.
    Add(Add a)
    Copy constructor that creates a new Add instance by copying the state of the given Add object.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    int
    calculate(String variable, int... args)
    Calculates the result of adding the left operand (`a`) and the first argument in the `args` array.
    Operators
    clone()
    Creates and returns a new Add instance that is a copy of the current Add operator.
    Operators
    setA(int a)
    Sets the left operand (`a`) for the addition operation.

      Parameters:
      a - The left operand to be used in the addition operation.

    • calculate

      public int calculate(String variable, int... args)
      Calculates the result of adding the left operand (`a`) and the first argument in the `args` array.
      Specified by:
      calculate in interface Operators
      Specified by:
      calculate in class BaseBinaryOperators
      Parameters:
      variable - The variable used in the calculation (currently unused in this method).
      args - The arguments passed to the calculation. The first argument represents the right operand.
      Returns:
      The result of adding the left operand (`a`) and the right operand (the first argument in `args`).
